content:
/**
 * @file Resname Colormaker
 * @author Alexander Rose <alexander.rose@weirdbyte.de>
 * @private
 */


import { ColormakerRegistry } from "../globals.js";
import Colormaker from "./colormaker.js";

// from Jmol http://jmol.sourceforge.net/jscolors/ (protein + shapely for nucleic)
var ResidueColors = {
    "ALA": 0x8CFF8C,
    "ARG": 0x00007C,
    "ASN": 0xFF7C70,
    "ASP": 0xA00042,
    "CYS": 0xFFFF70,
    "GLN": 0xFF4C4C,
    "GLU": 0x660000,
    "GLY": 0xFFFFFF,
    "HIS": 0x7070FF,
    "ILE": 0x004C00,
    "LEU": 0x455E45,
    "LYS": 0x4747B8,
    "MET": 0xB8A042,
    "PHE": 0x534C52,
    "PRO": 0x525252,
    "SER": 0xFF7042,
    "THR": 0xB84C00,
    "TRP": 0x4F4600,
    "TYR": 0x8C704C,
    "VAL": 0xFF8CFF,

    "ASX": 0xFF00FF,
    "GLX": 0xFF00FF,
    "ASH": 0xFF00FF,
    "GLH": 0xFF00FF,

    "A": 0xA0A0FF,
    "G": 0xFF7070,
    "I": 0x80FFFF,
    "C": 0xFF8C4B,
    "T": 0xA0FFA0,
    "U": 0xFF8080,

    "DA": 0xA0A0FF,
    "DG": 0xFF7070,
    "DI": 0x80FFFF,
    "DC": 0xFF8C4B,
    "DT": 0xA0FFA0,
    "DU": 0xFF8080
};
var DefaultResidueColor = 0xFF00FF;


/**
 * Color by residue name
 */
class ResnameColormaker extends Colormaker{

    atomColor( a ){
        return ResidueColors[ a.resname ] || DefaultResidueColor;
    }

}


ColormakerRegistry.add( "resname", ResnameColormaker );


export default ResnameColormaker;

                               when the representation is updated often, e.g. by
                               changing the selection or the atom positions, as their
                               are no selection strings to be evaluated.

properties.name: radiusType
properties.description: A list of possible sources of the radius used for rendering the representation. The radius can be based on the *vdW radius*, the *covalent radius* or the *B-factor* value of the corresponding atom. Additionally the radius can be based on the *secondary structure*. Alternatively, when set to *size*, the value from the *radius* parameter is used for all atoms.

properties.name: radius
properties.description: A number providing a fixed radius used for rendering the representation.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: A number that scales the value defined by the *radius* or the *radiusType* parameter.

properties.name: assembly
properties.description: name of an assembly object. Included are the asymmetric unit (*AU*) corresponding to the coordinates given in the structure file, biological assemblies from *PDB*, *mmCIF* or *MMTF* files (*BU1*, *BU2*, ...), a filled (crystallographic) unitcell of a given space group (*UNITCELL*), a supercell consisting of a center unitcell and its 26 direct neighbors (*SUPERCELL*). Set to *default* to use the default asemmbly of the structure object.

params.name: silent
params.description: don't trigger a change event in the selection

params.name: what
params.description:
buffer data attributes to be updated,
                       note that this needs to be implemented in the
                       derived classes. Generally it allows more
                       fine-grained control over updating than
                       forcing a rebuild.

params.name: rebuild
params.description: whether or not to rebuild the representation

name: src/representation/surface-representation.js

properties.name: isolevelType
properties.description: Meaning of the isolevel value. Either *value* for the literal value or *sigma* as a factor of the sigma of the data. For volume data only.

properties.name: isolevel
properties.description: The value at which to create the isosurface. For volume data only.

properties.name: smooth
properties.description: How many iterations of laplacian smoothing after surface triangulation. For volume data only.

properties.name: background
properties.description: Render the surface in the background, unlit.

properties.name: opaqueBack
properties.description: Render the back-faces (where normals point away from the camera) of the surface opaque, ignoring of the transparency parameter.

properties.name: boxSize
properties.description: Size of the box to triangulate volume data in. Set to zero to triangulate the whole volume. For volume data only.

properties.name: useWorker
properties.description: Weather or not to triangulate the volume asynchronously in a Web Worker. For volume data only.

params.name: surface
params.description: the surface or volume to be represented

params.name: what
params.description:
buffer data attributes to be updated,
                       note that this needs to be implemented in the
                       derived classes. Generally it allows more
                       fine-grained control over updating than
                       forcing a rebuild.

params.name: rebuild
params.description: whether or not to rebuild the representation

name: MouseObserver
examples:
// listen to mouse moving (and touch-moving) events
mouseObserver.moved.moved.add( function( deltaX, deltaY ){ ... } );

// listen to scrolling (and pinching) events
mouseObserver.signals.scrolled.add( function( delta ){ ... } );

// listen to dragging (and touch-dragging) events
mouseObserver.signals.dragged.add( function( deltaX, deltaY ){ ... } );

// listen to clicking (and touch-clicking) events
mouseObserver.signals.clicked.add( function(){ ... } );

// listen to hovering events
mouseObserver.signals.hovered.add( function(){ ... } );

params.name: domElement
params.description: the dom element to observe mouse events in

params.name: params.hoverTimeout
params.description:
timeout until the {@link MouseSignals.hovered}
                                        signal is fired, set to -1 to ignore hovering

name: signals
description: Events emitted by the mouse observer

name: moving
description: Flag indicating if the mouse is moving

name: hovering
description: Flag indicating if the mouse is hovering

name: scrolled
description:
Flag indicating if there was a scolling event
since the last mouse move

name: which
description:
Indicates which mouse button was pressed:
0: No button; 1: Left button; 2: Middle button; 3: Right button

name: pressed
description: Flag indicating if the mouse is pressed down

name: altKey
description: Flag indicating if the alt key is pressed

name: ctrlKey
description: Flag indicating if the ctrl key is pressed

name: metaKey
description: Flag indicating if the meta key is pressed

name: shiftKey
description: Flag indicating if the shift key is pressed

name: StageSignals
examples: stage.signals.componentAdded.add( function( component ){ ... } );

name: Stage
description: Stage class, central for creating molecular scenes with NGL.
examples: var stage = new Stage( "elementId", { backgroundColor: "white" } );

name: tasks
description:
Counter that keeps track of various potentially long-running tasks,
including file loading and surface calculation.

name: defaultFileRepresentation
description: Create default representations for the given component

params.name: object
params.description: component to create the representations for

name: loadFile
description: Load a file onto the stage
examples:
// load from URL
stage.loadFile( "http://files.rcsb.org/download/5IOS.cif" );

// load a File object
stage.loadFile( file );

params.name: path
params.description: either a URL or an object containing the file data

params.name: params.asTrajectory
params.description: load multi-model structures as a trajectory

return.description:
A Promise object that resolves to a {@link StructureComponent},
                  a {@link SurfaceComponent} or a {@link ScriptComponent} object,
                  depending on the type of the loaded file.

name: addComponent
description: Add the given component to the stage

name: addComponentFromObject
description: Create a component from the given object and add to the stage

name: removeAllComponents
description: Remove all components from the stage

name: handleResize
description: Handle any size-changes of the container element

params.name: element
params.description:
document element to put into fullscreen,
                              defaults to the viewer container

name: setSpin
description: Spin the whole scene around an axis at the center
examples: stage.setSpin( [ 0, 1, 0 ], 0.01 );

params.name: angle
params.description: amount to spin per frame, radians

name: setRock
description: Rock the whole scene around an axis at the center

params.name: angle
params.description: amount to spin per frame, radians

name: autoView
description: Add a zoom and a move animation with automatic targets

name: makeImage
description: Make image from what is shown in a viewer canvas

return.description: A Promise object that resolves to an image {@link Blob}.

name: eachComponent
description: Iterator over each component and executing the callback

params.name: type
params.description: limit iteration to components of this type

name: eachRepresentation
description: Iterator over each representation and executing the callback

params.name: type
params.description: limit iteration to components of this type

name: getComponentsByName
description: Get collection of components by name

params.name: type
params.description: limit iteration to components of this type

name: getComponentsByObject
description: Get collection of components by object

name: getRepresentationsByName
description: Get collection of representations by name

params.name: type
params.description: limit iteration to components of this type

name: getAnythingByName
description: Get collection of components and representations by name

return.description: collection of selected components and representations

name: dispose
description: Cleanup when disposing of a stage object

AVHash

Modifed from SpatialHash

Main differences are:
- Optimized grid size to ensure we only ever need to look +/-1 cell
- Aware of atomic radii and will only output atoms within rAtom + rExtra
  (see withinRadii method)

(Uses rounding rather than bitshifting as consequence of arbitrary grid size)
